conclusion: Determine the power of the external force.
Conductor rod OC is rotating with angular velocity œâ in magnetic field B.
Induced EMF in the rod is calculated using Faraday's law: ùìî = B * r * v.
Linear velocity v of the end of the rod at C is rœâ.
Current I is found using Ohm's law: I = ùìî / R.
Power P generated by the current in the resistor R is P = I^2 * R.
Substitute the current to find power: P = (B^2 * r^4 * œâ^2) / R.
The power of the external force doing work is P = (B^2 * r^4 * œâ^2) / R.
